Posts.Content: May 24, 2009 06:09AM Jaimieh wrote: The surgery to put it in wasn't bad at all and I didn't fall asleep but instead I sat and talked to the doctor the entire time.  I think I embarrassed him a couple of time because I offered to show him my reconstruction.  The worst part for me was getting the IV in and then I didn't take anything afterward so my neck was sore.  Directly after the surgery I went shopping but I couldn't walk in a straight line so it was funny to me.  I love having a port because I don't feel a thing I put a little emla cream on ahead of time put saran wrap over it and I am good to go.  It makes for an easy day getting a needle.  I have a mini-port or something like that and you wouldn't have been able to see it if I had not lost 24 lbs :(  I don't care if people see it because it saves me pain.  Good luck with your surgery and treatment.  I think the anticipation is worse than the actual surgery.
